intro: Dalechampia brevipes, commonly known as the shortfoot dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with distinctive floral structures. The plant is characterized by its hairy, palmately lobed leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow-green in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as swamps and wetlands. Dalechampia brevipes is often found in association with other wetland flora, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
